metadata.title: CVE-2018-16888 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
It was discovered systemd does not correctly check the content of PIDFilefiles before using it to kill processes. When a service is run from anunprivileged user (e.g. User field set in the service file), a localattacker who is able to write to the PIDFile of the mentioned service mayuse this flaw to trick systemd into killing other services and/orprivileged processes. Versions before v237 are vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16888` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu21.27
udev - 229-4ubuntu21.27
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu21.27').
